project.teaser: The main objective of this Proposal is the organisation of the Young Talents Programme which contains two separate events. The first is the European Union Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS) 2022. The second is the development of a pilot for next stage researchers & early...
project.objective:
The main objective of this Proposal is the organisation of the Young Talents Programme which contains two separate events. The first is the European Union Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS) 2022. The second is the development of a pilot for next stage researchers & early career researchers with the working title EU TALENTON. Both events will be organized and held in Leiden, the Netherlands. Stichting Leiden European City of Science 2022 (Leiden2022) will be responsible for the organisation of the Young Talents Programme.
The primary aim of the EU Contest for Young Scientists is to stimulate exchanges between talented young scientists, ensure that young scientists get guidance from some of the most prominent scientists in Europe and eventually to highlight scientific student achievements and attract widespread media interest. In other words, providing additional stimulus to young people who have an already demonstrated interest in applying science to solve problems.
In the 2022 edition, Leiden aims to innovate the existing EUCYS model in several ways. into a more attractive contest. Leiden2022 aims to innovate EUCYS2022 in the following ways: - Reviewing the EUCYS award system - Researching if the scope of EUCYS can be expanded towards components of the Humanities (from STEM to STEAM) - Embedding EUCYS into the public and scientific programme of Leiden European City of Science 2022
Furthermore Leiden2022 aims to reach a more mature target group that is entering the next level of their research career by organizing a pilot. With this pilots Leiden2022 will explore the possibilities for organizing the EU TALENTON, and as such create a (potential) blueprint for EU TALENTON editions to follow. Therefore, EUCYS2022 and the EU TALENTON 2022 have the potential to have long lasting impact on the future of the Young Talents Programme. With this new approach, a broader group of young people will be attracted to (academic) careers in STEM and/or STEAM fields. By giving special attention to future prospects of participants and competition winners both within and outside of academics, The Young Talents Programme is more than a scientific competition alone as it creates a broad career perspective for young students and next stage and early career researchers ranging in age between 14 and presumably 24. Therefore, the Young Talents Programme is an instrument to achieve broader impact on young talent and society beyond the competitions itself (and the events connected to it).

article.title: The biggest science fair comes to Leiden

result.title: Application forms EUCYS
result.description: The application forms for EUCYS2022 will be ready and implemented on the website of EUCYS2022

result.title: Preliminary EUCYS Programme
result.description: The preliminary core programme of EUCYS2022 will be delivered

result.title: Contest catalogue EUCYS
result.description: The Contest catalogue for EUCYS2022 will be ready This will be done digitally as much as possible taking into account sustainability principles

result.title: Plans for visits and activities EUCYS
result.description: The plans for the visits and activities cultural programme for EUCYS2022 will be delivered

result.title: Plans for visits and activities for the pilot EU TALENTON
result.description: The plans for the visits and activities cultural programme for the pilot EU TALENTON will be delivered

result.title: Preliminary pilot programme
result.description: The preliminary programme of the pilot EU TALENTON will be delivered

result.title: Communication and dissemination Plan for the pilot EU TALENTON
result.description: In this plan the communication and dissemination for the pilot EU TALENTON will be described This includes all formal requirements regarding communication and visual identity web presence press and media presence promotion and how we will disseminate the activities to the public

result.title: Networking plan
result.description: A networking plan will be delivered for EUCYS2022 and the pilot EU TALENTON

result.title: Final EUCYS Programme
result.description: The final programme for EUCYS2022 core programme and cultural programme will be delivered in a report and shared on the website

result.title: Pocket guide EUCYS
result.description: The pocket guide for EUCYS 2022 will contain a summary description of the Contest giving the programme of activities and key information including emergency service numbers etc The pocket guide will be handed out during EUCYS

result.title: Policy brief on EUCYS and the pilot EU TALENTON
result.description: We will make a policy brief for the European Commission with recommendations for the continuation of EUCYS for future editions based on the experience of the 2022 edition and the experimentation of the proposed innovations The Policy brief will have a separate part on recommendations with regards to the pilot EU TALENTON for future replications of the pilot

result.title: Application process for the EU TALENTON
result.description: For the pilot EU TALENTON we will determine what the most suitable application process would be and we will deliver the outcomes of this in a report and will also implement this on the website

result.title: Media monitoring report
result.description: We will monitor all Media coverage such as Social Media and Public Communications and will report this in the Media Monitoring report for EUCYS2022 as well as the pilot EU TALENTON

result.title: Communication and dissemination Plan EUCYS
result.description: In this plan the communication and dissemination for EUCYS2022 will be described This includes all formal requirements regarding communication and visual identity web presence press and media presence promotion and how we will disseminate the activities to the public The plan will be in line with all requirements related to EC visibility the contents of the contest catalogue press releases etc

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: In the Data Management Plan DMP we will outline how data will be handled during the project and after finalisation describing what data will be collectedgenerated what methodology and standards are used whether and how this data will be shared andor made open and how it will be curated and preserved The DMP will be a living document and will evolve and gain more precision and substance during the lifespan of our project

result.title: Website launch
result.description: The website for EUCYS2022 and the pilot EU TALENTON will be launched publicly

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EUCYS2022 (EUCYS Leiden2022)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Leiden was European City of Science in 2022 and therefore hosted the 33rd edition of the EU Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS). The primary aim of hosting EUCYS2022 was to provide additional stimulus and empowerment to young people who have an already demonstrated interest...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Rules and Guidelines for the pilot EU TALENTON
result.description: In the event of the pilot being extended to an annual event which will be discussed and the decided with the European Commission we will develop a set of rules and guidleness similar to those for EUCYS

result.title: Descriptions of Host country prizes EUCYS
result.description: The descriptions of the Host Country prizes for EUCYS2022 will be ready and delivered in a report as well as implemented on the website of EUCYS2022

result.title: Final pilot programme
result.description: The final programme for the pilot EU TALENTON core programme and cultural programme will be delivered in a report and shared on the website

result.title: Description of prizes of the pilot EU TALENTON
result.description: For the pilot EU TALENTON we will research and determine what kind of prizes would fit best The descriptions of these prizes will be delivered in a report as well as implemented on the website

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
